II-VI Incorporated is a fully integrated manufacturer of laser optic materials, optics, components, and electro-optical products ranging from gamma ray to far infrared wavelengths. II-VI EpiWorks, located in Champaign, Illinois, is part of the OptoElectronics Group of II-VI Incorporated.  The OptoElectronics Group manufactures high-power semiconductor lasers, including single emitters and bars enabling fiber and direct diode lasers, VCSELs for 3D sensing in consumer electronics and automotive applications, and III-V epitaxial wafers to enable higher performance photonic and RF components for consumer, communications, network and mobile applications.

Epitaxial devices consist of nanolayers of semiconductor crystals that are uniformly deposited inside sophisticated deposition tools to form an "epi-wafer." Combining different semiconductor materials and dopants in an epi wafer is the key step in determining the performance capabilities of photonics and RF semiconductor components.

II-VI Incorporated recognizes its responsibilities under Section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act to handle all Extremely Hazardous Substances safely and to prevent accidental release.  II-VI EpiWorks maintains a Process Safety Management Program which incorporates a prevention program including the use of process safety information, operating procedures, employee training, mechanical integrity, process hazard analysis, management of change, pre-start up reviews, incident investigations, compliance audits, and contractor safety programs.

II-VI is committed to maintaining the highest regard for health, safety, and the environment wherever it operates in the world.

"At II-VI Incorporated, the health and safety of our employees are a primary concern. We know that all our  lives have immeasurable value, both to the company and to our families, and we must all work together to ensure that our working environment is as safe as it can be."

"We feel that by taking the steps necessary to ensure that o

ur employees are safe, the benefits of our efforts will encompass the community and the environment" 

II-VI EpiWorks utilizes Arsine gas in the chemical vapor deposition process to produce III-V epitaxial wafers. Arsine is a liquefied gas. It is stored in DOT-approved cylinders in secure storage rooms. Each cylinder is equipped with protective devices for storage and delivery purposes.  At room temperature and atmospheric pressure, Arsine is a colorless gas.  The toxic properties of Arsine make it necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling these cylinders to prevent unnecessary human exposure, to reduce the threat to our own personal health as well as our co-workers, and to minimize  the threat to nearby members of the community. 

Access to the manufacturing areas of the facility is restricted to authorized employees, authorized management personnel and authorized contractors.  

This facility complies with the following Federal regulations:

?    6  CFR 27 Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism Standards (CFATS)

?    29 CFR 1910.38 Emergency Action Plans (EAPs)

?    29 CFR 1910.119 Process Safety Management (PSM) of Highly Hazardous Chemicals

?    40 CFR 68 Risk Management Program

?    40 CFR 264, Subpart D; 40 CFR 265, Subpart D; and 40 CFR 279.52 Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) Contingency Planning Requirements 

II-VI EpiWorks employs several different controls to prevent accidental releases. Arsine cylinders are contained in a secure vault; access to this vault is restricted to authorized employees. Each cylinder in service is placed in an approved cabinet that is under vacuum and exhausted through ducting. All Arsine piping is double-walled and has welded joints. Toxic gas monitoring systems have sample points in all production areas where employees maintain a constant presence, as well as points inside the tools and exhaust ducting. Trained personnel wear SCBA respiratory protection for any activity where the closed system will be opened and A

rsine could be present, including changing gas cylinders. Receiving deliveries of Arsine cylinders is completed only during specified hours and with DOT trained personnel.

We have not had any incidents or accidents involving the regulated substance in our covered process.

This facility's emergency response program includes coordination with the regional HAZMAT response team. Evacuation drills are conducted at least annually with all employees.  Alarm systems are tested annually to ensure proper activation. This program has been reviewed with the Champaign Fire Department. Several members of the Champaign Fire Department visited this facility the second week of March 2018. 

Through our ongoing cycle of continuous improvement and auditing of the PSM/RMP programs, II-VI EpiWorks looks continuously for ways to improve our facility's safety and ability to prevent accidental releases.
